com.nokia.maps.component.touch

Class InfoBubbleComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.component.AbstractMapComponent
      • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.TouchComponent
        • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.VisibleTouchComponent
          • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.InfoBubbleComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapComponent

    public class InfoBubbleComponent
extends VisibleTouchComponent
    This class defines a MapComponent which associates an infobubble to a MapObject. When the MapObject is moved to the centre of the screen the associated infobubble text is displayed. Infobubbles are touchable, and a Command can also be associated with a MapObject, which fires whenever the infobubble is touched or the fire key is pressed.

    • Field Summary

      This constant defines a unique ID for the Infobubble Component.

      • attach

        public void attach(MapDisplay map)

        Overrides:

      • touchAt

        protected void touchAt(Point point)
        This method fires an associated command if the InfoBubble has been touched.
        Overrides:
        touchAt in class VisibleTouchComponent
        Parameters:
        point - the position touched on screen

      • onTouchEventStart

        protected boolean onTouchEventStart(int x,
                        int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a pointer press has started. This action cause the the UI to be Highlighted when it is touched.
        Overrides:
        onTouchEventStart in class VisibleTouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        false since the touch event is not consumed by default.

      • onDragEvent

        protected boolean onDragEvent(int x,
                  int y)
        This method handles the drag event by shifting the text of the infobubble on screen.
        Overrides:
        onDragEvent in class VisibleTouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if the component consumes the event, false otherwise. Drag events are consumed if they occur within the hit area of the MapComponent, and the menu is currently visible.

      • onFlickEvent

        public boolean onFlickEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   float direction,
                   int speed,
                   int speedX,
                   int speedY)
        This method handles the Flick event by moving the text within the infobubble based on the speed of the flick.

        Note the MapComponent must be placed on a GestureMapCanvas if it is to receive flick() events.

        Overrides:
        onFlickEvent in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the flick event occurred.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the flick event occurred.
        direction - direction of the flick event.
        speed - speed of the flick.
        speedX - speed of the flick on the x axis.
        speedY - speed of the flick on the y axis.
        Returns:
        true if the component consumes the event, false otherwise. Flick events are consumed if they occur within the hit area of the MapComponent, and the menu is currently visible.

      • onTouchEventClear

        protected boolean onTouchEventClear(int x,
                        int y)
        Hides the infobubble since the clear event has occurred.
        Overrides:
        onTouchEventClear in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        false since the touch event is not consumed by default.

      • onFireEvent

        public boolean onFireEvent()
        This method fires a Command when the FIRE key is pressed and the Infobubble is active. This means that non-touch phone are able to use the Infobubble via keypad input.
        Overrides:
        onFireEvent in class TouchComponent
        Returns:
        true if the fire key was pressed, the Infobubble is currently active and a Command has been associated to this Infobubble

      • mapUpdated

        public void mapUpdated(boolean zoomChanged)
        This method is called when the map is updated, a check is made to see if one of the associated MapObjects is at the centre of the screen and if so, the Infobubble is displayed. The Infobubble is cleared otherwise.
        Specified by:
        mapUpdated in interface MapComponent
        Overrides:
        mapUpdated in class AbstractMapComponent
        Parameters:
        zoomChanged - Whether the zoom level of the MapDisplay has been changed.
